item.title: Interacting with SOAP based web services from Cocoa
item.author: mark@markrichman.com (Mark Richman)
item.description: SOAP based web services and Cocoa have never been good friends, and although REST based webservices are fortunately today’s standard there are still tons of SOAP-based ones out there. What has always been missing in Cocoa is high level support for interacting with SOAP-based webservices. Here I describe one way in which you can build such frameworks yourself, starting by analysing the webservice calls in detail in this part 1 and generating the necessary Cocoa classes for use in a Mac or iPhone application next time.
